result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week , or perform 9 hours per week.

No contact with A.F. or her immediate family. No contact with E.K.H. unless given dept approval and only after psychological examinations of the child (E.K.H.) the Mother (A.F.) and the deft have been completed. Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorizations. Absolutely no access to any device that allows access to the internet or social media sites including but not limited to smart phones, smart televisions, or computers.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate  by the dept.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:50 pm 
State appears by Public Interest Special Prosecutor Mike Puerner; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Kat Jackan.  
State notes parties have reached an agreement re: misd. files. 

PLEA HEARING IN 15CM864, 15CM2011, AND 15CM2393. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to: 
In 15CM864: Ct. 1 (Violate Foreign Protection Order)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM2011: Ct. 1 (Violate Foreign Protection Order)>>DISMISS. 
                       : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>DISMISS. 
                       : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>DISMISS. 
In 15CM2393: Cts. 3-30 (Contempt/Ct-Nonsummary/Punitive Sanction)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: 
In 15CM2393: Ct. 1 (Contempt/Ct-Nonsummary/Punitive Sanction)>>NO CONTEST. 
                       : Ct. 2 (Contempt/Ct-Nonsummary/Punitive Sanction)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

SENTENCING HEARING IN 15CF977 AND 15CM2393. 
COURT questions counsel re: review of PSI and alternate PSI submitted by the defense. 
Atty Jackan makes statement re: PSI. No additions/corrections by the State. 
A.F. makes statement. 
Argument. 
Def makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF977: Ct. 1>>35 years imprisonment with 407 days credit - 20 years IC and 15 years ES - CONDITIONS OF ES: no contact with A.F. or her immediate family; no contact with E.K.H. unless given dept approval and only after psychological examinations of the child (E.K.H.), the mother (A.F.), and the def have been completed; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; comply with sex offender registry; absolutely no access to any device that allows access to the Internet or social media sites including but not limited to smart phones, smart televisions, or computers; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
                    : Ct. 3>>90 days MCJ with 407 days credit. 
                    : Ct. 4>>9 months MCJ with 407 days credit. 
In 15CM2393: Ct. 1>>1 year MCJ with 1 year credit; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
                       : Ct. 2>>1 year MCJ with 1 year credit; CC. 
COURT remits court costs in 15CM2393. 
COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 
COURT finds the def NOT eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT allows counsel to retain their copies of the PSI and advises them to maintain their confidentiality. 
COURT ORDERS alternative PSI SEALED. 
COURT remands def into custody for transport to WI Correctional System. 

Adj: 3:12 pm

Sentencing Hearing on 12/05/16
Surety - No such house number
Sentencing hearing on December 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
and Defense Motion to Admit Evidence of Another Source of Semen
Jury questions-sealed
State's final offer
Opening Instructions

1-Guilty
2-Not Guilty
3-Guilty

Clerk Marisa. 
Called: 8:42 am  
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Defendant appears in person with Atty Kat Jackan. 
Date and time set for hearing on deft's motion to admit evidence of another source of semen. 
Argument. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT gives ruling - denies motion. 
Atty Jackan moves to dismiss attempt. 
Argument. 
COURT notes it will review case law and rule on oral motion later. 
Adj: 8:55 am

Clerk Marisa. 
Called: 9:07 am 
JURY TRIAL DAY 2.  
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Defendant appears in person with Atty Kat Jackan. 
Jury is NOT present. 
9:10 am - Jury reconvenes. Officer Kou Moua (EMPD) sworn and testifies. 
9:36 am - Officer Luis Lopes-Serrao (Wausau PD) sworn and testifies. 
9:46 am - Officer Cody Swearingen (EMPD) sworn and testifies. 
9:53 am - Jury recesses. COURT notes sidebars on the record. 
9:55 am - COURT recesses. 
10:17 am - COURT reconvenes. 
10:18 am - Jury reconvenes. L.L. sworn and testifies. 
10:53 am - T.S. sworn and testifies. 
10:57 am - Rebecca Bohr (DNA analyst) sworn and testifies. 
11:11 am - Jury recesses. COURT notes sidebars on the record. State notes it has no further witnesses and notes intent to rest. Atty Jackan moves for directed verdict. COURT notes Atty Jackan's motion to dismiss Ct. 2. COURT makes findings and gives ruling re: dismissing Ct. 2 - denies motion. COURT makes findings and gives ruling re: motion for directed verdict - denies motion. COURT questions def re: testifying. Def states intent to testify. COURT finds def has freely, knowingly, and voluntarily decided to testify. 
11:23 am - Jury reconvenes. State rests on the record. 
11:25 am - COURT and jury recesses. 
1:11 pm - COURT and jury reconvenes. G.H. sworn and testifies. 
1:39 pm - Defense rests. State has no rebuttal. Evidence is closed. 
1:40 pm - Jury recesses. Parties address jury instructions. COURT notes sidebar on the record. COURT notes exhibits will not be sent back with the jury. 

**COURT ORDERS EXHIBITS SEALED.** 

1:52 pm - COURT recesses.
2:19 pm - COURT reconvenes. 
2:21 pm - Jury reconvenes. COURT gives jury instructions. 
2:44 pm - Closing arguments by the State. 
3:09 pm - Closing arguments by Atty Jackan. 
3:18 pm - Rebuttal closing arguments by the State. 
3:25 pm - COURT gives jury instructions. 
3:30 pm - Bailiffs sworn and Jury exits to deliberate. COURT notes correction to jury instructions. 
3:32 pm - COURT recesses. 
6:40 pm - COURT reconvenes - ADA Puerner and Atty Jackan are present - def is NOT present. COURT notes jury request. Parties agree upon response to jury request. COURT sends response back to the jury room. 
6:41 pm - COURT recesses. 
8:09 pm - COURT and Jury reconvene. Jury has reached a verdict. COURT reads verdicts. 

                     Verdict: Ct. 1 (2nd Degree SA - Use of Force/DA)>>GUILTY. 
                                 : Ct. 2 (2nd Degree SA - Use of Force/Attempt/DA)>>NOT GUILTY. 
                                 : Ct. 3 (DC/DA)>>GUILTY. 

COURT questions jury if these are their verdicts. COURT polls the jury. COURT accepts the verdicts of the jury. COURT thanks the jury and excuses the jury. 
State requests judgment be entered on Cts. 1, 3, and 4.
COURT enters judgment of convictions on Cts. 1, 3, and 4. 
COURT enters judgment of acquittal on Ct. 2. 
COURT orders PSI be completed and prepared within 6 weeks of today's date. 
COURT revokes def's bond and remands def into custody of the sheriff's dept pending sentencing. 
CC set for 7/20/2016 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA to set sentencing hearing. 
Adj: 8:14 pm
Jurors Selection and Peremptory Challenges (List of sworn jurors)

Clerk Marisa. 
Called: 9:28 am 
JURY TRIAL DAY 1. 
BAILIFF OPENS COURT. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Defendant appears in person with Atty Kat Jackan. 
Jury Panel is present. 
9:29 am - Jury panel sworn. COURT gives statement of the case. 
9:31 am - State introduces himself and names his witnesses. 
9:31 am - Atty Jackan introduces herself and her client. 
9:32 am - Voir Dire by the Court. 
9:36 am - Voir Dire by the State. 
10:31 am - Juror seated number #14 M.J.P. is struck by COURT for cause and replaced by Juror seated #21 R.J.S. 
10:36 am - Voir Dire by Atty Jackan. 
10:43 am - Juror seated number #18 J.M.C. is struck by COURT for cause and replaced by Juror seated #22 A.M.R. 
11:04 am - COURT thanks and excuses Jurors seated behind the rail. 
11:06 am - Parties make their strikes. 
11:11 am - COURT reads Jurors selected. COURT thanks & excuses those not selected. 
11:13 am - COURT reads Preliminary Jury Instructions. 
11:19 am - Jury exits to make phone calls. 
11:20 am - COURT questions parties re: schedule. 
11:21 am - COURT recesses. 
11:43 am - COURT reconvenes. State raises concerns re: openings. 
11:48 am - Jury reconvenes and is sworn. 
11:48 am - Opening Statements by the State. 
11:59 am - Opening Statements by Atty Jackan. 
12:12 pm - Jury recesses. State makes statement. 
12:13 pm - COURT recesses. 
1:53 pm - COURT and Jury Reconvenes. A.F. sworn and testifies. COURT reads jury instruction. Testimony continues with A.F. 
3:30 pm - Jury recesses. COURT notes sidebar on the record. 
3:32 pm - COURT recesses. 
3:48 pm - COURT and Jury reconvenes. Testimony continues with A.F. COURT reads jury instruction. 
4:14 pm - Jury recesses for the night. Jury to reconvene tomorrow at 9:00 am. COURT notes sidebars on the record. State makes statement. 
4:21 pm - COURT recesses. Counsel to be present tomorrow at 8:30 am.

Clerk Marisa.
